# The President's Man: A Line in the Sand

| related            = ''The President's Man
}}
'''The President's Man: A Line in the Sand' is a 2002 American made-for-television action film starring Chuck Norris and Judson Mills. It is a sequel to ''The President's Man and is the second installment in the The President's Man'' film series. It was first shown on CBS on January 20, 2002. The film was directed by Norris' son Eric Norris and co-produced by his brother Aaron Norris.
Plot
Secret agent Joshua McCord (Chuck Norris) is assigned by President Adam Mayfield (Robert Urich) to prevent a band of terrorists from setting off a nuclear device in a U.S. city. McCord has to infiltrate the terrorists' headquarters and disarm the bomb. Deke Slater (Judson Mills), McCord's younger assistant, develops a relationship with McCord's daughter Que (Jennifer Tung).
